1.title: City Arena
1.location: Kamberovića polje, Zenica, Bosnia and Herzegovina
1.description: The City Arena is designed as a multifunctional hall equipped with the most modern equipment and is capable of holding sports, musical and other social events. The capacity of the hall is 6,300 seats.

2.title: Zenica City Museum
2.description: Museum building is situated in heart of Zenica between Old town and river Bosna. It was built on the site of a building from the Ottoman period and during the design phase it was payed special attention that the new building's shape keep the memory of the old building. The Museum complex consists of a reinforced conrete building - a museum building and a transparent glass garden set towards river Bosna. During the design phase special attention was paid to the entry of the daylight to interior of the building . All exhibition floors(ground floor, first floor and attic) are connected with a skylights which enable daylight to enter all three floors in the same "vertical". Attic roof and floor are partially made of transpartent glass while the first floor has opening in the middle.

3.title: Training Center of the Football Association of BiH
3.client: The Football Association of Bosnia and Herzegovina
3.description: Training center facility encompasses two full size football fields(one with natural and one with artificial grass), covered artificial grass field for indoor football and covered stand for 1500 spectators(alongside natural grass field). Hotel facilities(for accomondation of athletes), administrative offices and wellness center are situated inside the stand.

4.title: Music Academy and Academy of Performing Arts
4.location: The University of Sarajevo Campus, Sarajevo
4.description:
The complex of buildings consists of two main parts connected by a covered pedestrian street that goes in a north-south direction. Building of the Academy of Performing Arts is on west side and Music Academy with a large Concert Hall is on east side.
Design of the academy complex has four parts that form one whole:
1) Music Academy with a small concert hall
2) Large Concert hall
3) Academy of Performing Arts with film and TV studios
4) Covered pedestrian street

5.title: Athletic Stadium
5.description: Optimal capacity of the covered stand approx. 3000 seats.

services: Preliminary and Main Reconstruction Design, Interior Design, Construction Works Supervision
6.title: Council of Ministers (Government Building)
6.client: The Government of the Hellenic Republic on behalf of the European Commission (HiPERB programme)
6.description: Building 3 of the Institutions of Bosnia and Herzegovina was built in 1976. The author of the design is the architect Juraj Neidhart. The building housed the Executive Council (Government) of SR Bosnia and Herzegovina. The building has two underground floors and 22 above-ground floors. During the war from 1992 to 1995 the building was shelled and set on fire which was the reason for reconstruction.

7.title: International Border Crossing "Izačić"
7.client: World Bank and Federal Ministry of Finance
7.description: Preliminary and Main Design in collaboration with architect Srećko Kreitmayer.

8.title: House of Football
8.client: The Football Association of Bosnia and Herzegovina
8.description: The existing facility was built in the early eighties of the XX century for the needs of the Geodetic Institute of BiH. During the war from 1992 to 1995, the building suffered some damage caused by shelling. With the new design facility retains the administrative function it had before but it has been modernized and adapted to new users.

9.title: Service for Foreigners' Affairs
9.client: Ministry of Security of BiH, Service for Foreigners

services: Architectural - Urban Design of whole complex
Preliminary and Main Design of the Sports Hall, Football field stand, Administrative Building and Relax Building
10.title: Sports Center "Babin do"
10.location: Bjelašnica Mountain near Sarajevo (Trnovo Municipality), Bosnia and Herzegovina
10.description: Sports and Recreation Center "Babin do" is located on Bjelašnica Mountain at an altitude of about 1300 meters. Approximate dimensions of complex are 451 m(length)x280 m(width). Complex encompasses 2 full size football fields, sports hall, relax facility, covered football field stand with a capacity of 1000 spectators, administrative building, 4-star hotel, restaurant and fourteen apartment buildings. During design phase, special care was taken to keep the existing trees.

11.title: B&H Arena
11.description:
Football stadium "B&H Arena" is located on the territory of the Municipality of Novi Grad in Sarajevo.
The maximum capacity of the stadium is 30,305 spectators, and it meets all the criteria of the IV category according to the conditions of UEFA and FIFA and it has the possibility of obtaining the status of an Elite category stadium.
The dimensions of the stadium are 194.20m x 151.00m.
Along the longer axis, the stadium is oriented in a standard north-south direction.The main stand is located on the west side of the stadium.
The stadium has a ground floor and three floors. Spectators area is completely covered and it is divided into two levels.
The stadium is well connected with other parts of the city,Corridor 5C highway, train and bus stations and the international airport.

12.title: Business Center "AKSA"
12.description:
Business Center Aksa is located in the center of Zenica city on the corner of Bašagić Street and Tarabar Street.
West side of the building is connected to existing building of "Prostor" and together with the "Prostor" building it closes a inner courtyard in which the fountain is located. This courtyard is accessible by a staircases from Mehmedalija Tarabar's Street and from Safet Beg Bašagić's Street(on opposite side).

services: Preliminary and Detailed Design according to the winning Preliminary Design at the "Competition for the Preliminary Design of the Academy of Performing Arts"
14.title: Academy of Performing Arts, Sarajevo
14.client: Institute for Construction of Sarajevo Canton
14.description: Preliminary design which was the basis for the Detailed design was made according to the first-prize winning preliminary design of architectural competition. Author of winning work was architect Jonus Ademović from New York. Building has 2 underground floors, ground floor, 4 floors and 2-level attic.

15.title: University Library
15.location: The University of Sarajevo Campus, Bosnia and Herzegovina
15.client: Saudi Development Fund and University of Sarajevo
15.description:
The Detailed design was made on the basis of the Preliminary design made by architect and professor Adnan Pašić.
 University Library is positioned on the main entrance street of University Campus. Main entrance to the building is on west side and it is oriented towards main Campus square.
Building has two underground levels, ground floor and two above ground floors.

16.title: Orčevići Mosque
16.location: Orčevići, Željezno Polje, Bosnia and Herzegovina
16.client: Majlis of the Islamic Community of Žepče, Džemat Orčevići
16.description:
Mosque is situated on a very sharp sloped terrain in landslide-prone area.
Parcel is bounded by an existing road on the north side and by imam's house on the northeast side.
On the southwest and southeast side there is a steep slope. Access path to low ground floor of the mosque is formed as a cantilever above the slope and retaining walls were constructed to form flattened parts of the courtyard.
The building has an irregular shape with maximum dimensions of 21.05mx12.40m. It contains a low ground floor, ground floor, mahfil(upper floor) and minaret that is not physically connected to the building (outside of the mentioned dimensions).

17.title: White Mosque
17.client: Majlis of the Islamic Community of Zenica

18.title: Ensar Mosque
18.description:
"Ensar" mosque is located in the city neighborhood "Babina Rijeka" in the new part of Zenica. The mosque has all the traditional elements recreated in a modern way.
The mosque is characterized by an atrium-shaped vestibule surrounded by a colonnade with arches. Atrium (harem) contains two fountains. At the client's request, the atrium is covered with a four-aisled vault with a transparent cover.

19.title: Cantonal Prosecutor's Office
19.client: Delegation of European Union to BiH

20.title: Pavilion IX of Zenica Penitentiary
20.client: Delegation of European Union to BiH

21.title: Educational Facility and Sports Hall of Orašje Prison
21.area:
Educational building 955,55 m<sup>2</sup>
Sports hall 612 m<sup>2</sup>
21.client: Delegation of European Union to BiH

23.client: FK Velez Mostar and FK Radnik Bijeljina

25.client: Fund for housing construction of Sarajevo Canton
